page.title: 03PINCHBECK'S ENDOWED SCHOOL.
page.content: {Pinchbeck's Endowed School}or{ {Butterwick,}as it is sometimes called, was built in {1973.}In {1665 {Anthony Pinchbeck }left land in trust to be rented out and the rent to be used to build a school,a headmaster's house and pay his salary.The school and house were completed the following year and the original {1666 }school and house are still standing and are still in use.The school as a {Youth {Club}and a {Community Centre }and the house is occupied by the local {vicar. A second school was built in {1887 } when education for all up to 14 was introduced,this school was for {boys} from {7_14 }while the infants and girls remained at the old school which had other rooms added to it.The new { {1973 }school was built behind this boys school which was knocked down in late 1972.
